info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 24 at 7:36PM CDT until June 25 at 3:41PM CDT by NWS Des Moines IA
info.description:
...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Iowa...
Thompson River at Davis City affecting Decatur County.
.Heavy rain from last night into this morning has resulted in significant rises on the Thompson River. Additional rainfall is falling or expected tonight. This river rise is expected to continue into this evening and river flooding will be possible.
* WHAT...Flooding is possible.
* WHERE...The Thompson River at Davis City, or from the City of Grand River to the Iowa-Missouri border.
* WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs at the Davis City park including the campgrounds. Water affects Hwy R15 just north of the town of Grand River in northwest Decatur County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
info.instruction:
For the latest waterway observations and forecasts refer to weather.gov/desmoines/water.
River forecasts include observed precipitation plus forecast precipitation over the next 24 hours.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON
